  • Method Details

    • commitOffsets

      public StreamApi.CommitOffsetsAdapter commitOffsets(String hrn, Optional<String> baseUrl, String layerId, com.here.platform.data.client.base.generated.scaladsl.model.stream.CommitOffsetsRequest commitOffsetsRequest, Optional<String> subscriptionId, Optional<String> mode)
      After reading data, you should commit the offset of the last message read from each partition so that your application can resume reading new messages from the correct partition in the event that there is a disruption to the subscription, such as an application crash. An offset can also be useful if you delete a subscription then recreate a subscription for the same layer, because the new subscription can start reading data from the offset. To read messages already committed, use the /seek endpoint, then use /partitions. The base path to use is the value of 'nodeBaseURL' returned from /subscribe POST request.

      Path: /layers/{layerId}/offsets

      Method: PUT

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : (OK, offsets committed) Headers : X-Correlation-ID -

      code 202 : (OK, offsets committed. This status indicates that your multi-region catalog had a failover or failback event, and you have committed offsets from previous region. No actions are needed from you.) Headers : X-Correlation-ID -

      code 400 : ErrorResponse (Bad Request)

      code 401 : InlineResponse401 (401 Unauthorized)

      code 403 : InlineResponse403 (403 Forbidden)

      code 404 : ErrorResponse (Not found)

      code 409 : ErrorResponse (Conflict)

      code 412 : ErrorResponse (Pre-condition failed)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal Server Error)

      Parameters:
      hrn - The HERE Resource Name (HRN) of the catalog.
      baseUrl - Base URL without path parameters and query.
      layerId - The ID of the stream layers.
      commitOffsetsRequest - The offsets to commit. It should be same as the offset of the message you wish to commit. Do not pass offset + 1 as mentioned in Kafka Consumer documentation. The service adds one to the offset you specify.
      subscriptionId - The subscriptionId received in the response of the /subscribe request (required if mode=parallel).
      mode - The subscription mode of this subscriptionId (as provided in /subscribe POST API).

    • commitOffsets

      public StreamApi.CommitOffsetsBuilder commitOffsets()

    • consumeData

      public StreamApi.ConsumeDataAdapter consumeData(String hrn, Optional<String> baseUrl, String layerId, Optional<String> subscriptionId, Optional<String> mode)
      Consumes data from a layer. Returns messages from a stream layer formatted similar to a [Partition object](https://heremaps.github.io/here-workspace-examples-java-scala/scala/com/here/platform/data/client/scaladsl/Partition.html). If the data size is less than 1 MB, the data field will be populated. If the data size is greater than 1 MB, a data handle will be returned pointing to the object stored in the Blob store. The base path to be used is the value of 'nodeBaseURL' returned from /subscribe POST request.

      Path: /layers/{layerId}/partitions

      Method: GET

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : ConsumeDataResponse (OK) Headers : X-Correlation-ID -

      code 400 : ErrorResponse (Bad Request)

      code 401 : InlineResponse401 (401 Unauthorized)

      code 403 : InlineResponse403 (403 Forbidden)

      code 404 : ErrorResponse (Not found)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal Server Error)

      code 503 : ErrorResponse (Service Unavailable error)

      Parameters:
      hrn - The HERE Resource Name (HRN) of the catalog.
      baseUrl - Base URL without path parameters and query.
      layerId - The ID of the stream layers.
      subscriptionId - The subscriptionId received in the response of the /subscribe request (required if mode=parallel).
      mode - The subscription mode of this subscriptionId (as provided in /subscribe POST API).

    • consumeData

      public StreamApi.ConsumeDataBuilder consumeData()

    • deleteSubscription

      public StreamApi.DeleteSubscriptionAdapter deleteSubscription(String hrn, Optional<String> baseUrl, String layerId, Optional<String> subscriptionId, Optional<String> mode, Optional<String> xRequestID)
      Deletes a subscription to a layer (topic). This operation removes the subscription from the service. The base path to use is the value of 'nodeBaseURL' returned from /subscribe POST request.

      Path: /layers/{layerId}/subscribe

      Method: DELETE

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : (OK - Subscription was deleted successfully)

      code 400 : ErrorResponse (Bad Request)

      code 401 : InlineResponse401 (401 Unauthorized)

      code 403 : InlineResponse403 (403 Forbidden)

      code 404 : ErrorResponse (Not found)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal Server Error)

      Parameters:
      hrn - The HERE Resource Name (HRN) of the catalog.
      baseUrl - Base URL without path parameters and query.
      layerId - The ID of the stream layers.
      subscriptionId - The subscriptionId received in the response of the /subscribe request (required if mode=parallel).
      mode - The subscription mode of this subscriptionId (as provided in /subscribe POST API).
      xRequestID - User-provided token that can be used to trace a request or a group of requests sent to the service.

    • deleteSubscription

      public StreamApi.DeleteSubscriptionBuilder deleteSubscription()

    • endpoint

      public StreamApi.EndpointAdapter endpoint(String hrn, Optional<String> baseUrl, String layerId, Optional<Boolean> internal)
      Returns a list of Kafka Broker URL's, client ID (required to enforce quotas), and Group ID prefix. Type is set to a consumer.

      Path: /layers/{layerId}/endpoint

      Method: GET

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : StreamLayerEndpointResponse (OK)

      code 400 : ErrorResponse (Bad Request)

      code 401 : InlineResponse401 (401 Unauthorized)

      code 403 : InlineResponse403 (403 Forbidden)

      code 404 : ErrorResponse (Not found)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal Server Error)

      Parameters:
      hrn - The HERE Resource Name (HRN) of the catalog.
      baseUrl - Base URL without path parameters and query.
      layerId - The ID of the stream layers.
      internal - Specifies whether internal bootstrap servers will be returned in the response.

    • endpoint

      public StreamApi.EndpointBuilder endpoint()

    • endpointByConsumer

      public StreamApi.EndpointByConsumerAdapter endpointByConsumer(String hrn, Optional<String> baseUrl, String layerId, String _type)
      Exposes the endpoint to use to produce and consume the data of the layer directly, per type of user - consumer or producer. It returns a list of Kafka Broker URL's, client ID (required to enforce quotas), and Group ID prefix.

      Path: /layers/{layerId}/{type}/endpoint

      Method: GET

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : StreamLayerEndpointResponse (OK)

      code 400 : ErrorResponse (Bad Request)

      code 401 : InlineResponse401 (401 Unauthorized)

      code 403 : InlineResponse403 (403 Forbidden)

      code 404 : ErrorResponse (Not found)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal Server Error)

      Parameters:
      hrn - The HERE Resource Name (HRN) of the catalog.
      baseUrl - Base URL without path parameters and query.
      layerId - The ID of the stream layers.
      _type - Identifies whether the properties returned in the response are for a producer or consumer.

    • endpointByConsumer

      public StreamApi.EndpointByConsumerBuilder endpointByConsumer()

    • seekToOffset

      public StreamApi.SeekToOffsetAdapter seekToOffset(String hrn, Optional<String> baseUrl, String layerId, com.here.platform.data.client.base.generated.scaladsl.model.stream.SeekOffsetsRequest seekOffsetsRequest, Optional<String> subscriptionId, Optional<String> mode)
      Enables you to start reading data from a specified offset. You can move the message pointer to any offset in the layer (topic). Message consumption will start from that offset. Once you seek to an offset, there is no returning to the initial offset, unless the initial offset is saved. The base path to use is the value of 'nodeBaseURL' returned from /subscribe POST request.

      Path: /layers/{layerId}/seek

      Method: PUT

      Expected answers:

      code 200 : (OK, seek successful) Headers : X-Correlation-ID -

      code 400 : ErrorResponse (Bad Request)

      code 401 : InlineResponse401 (401 Unauthorized)

      code 403 : InlineResponse403 (403 Forbidden)

      code 404 : ErrorResponse (Not found)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal Server Error)

      Parameters:
      hrn - The HERE Resource Name (HRN) of the catalog.
      baseUrl - Base URL without path parameters and query.
      layerId - The ID of the stream layers.
      seekOffsetsRequest - List of offsets and offset partitions
      subscriptionId - The subscriptionId received in the response of the /subscribe request (required if mode=parallel).
      mode - The subscription mode of this subscriptionId (as provided in /subscribe POST API).

    • seekToOffset

      public StreamApi.SeekToOffsetBuilder seekToOffset()

    • subscribe

      public StreamApi.SubscribeAdapter subscribe(String hrn, String layerId, Optional<String> mode, Optional<String> subscriptionId, Optional<String> consumerId, Optional<com.here.platform.data.client.base.generated.scaladsl.model.stream.SubscriptionProperties> subscriptionProperties)
      Enables message consumption from a specific stream layer (topic). Use the base path returned from the API Lookup service. Note: For **mode = parallel**, one unit of parallelism currently equals 1 MBps inbound or 2 MBps outbound, whichever is greater, rounded up to the nearest integer. The number of subscriptions within the same group cannot exceed the parallelism allowed. For more details see [Get Data from a Stream Layer](https://www.here.com/docs/bundle/data-api-developer-guide/page/rest/getting-data-stream.html).

      Path: /layers/{layerId}/subscribe

      Method: POST

      Expected answers:

      code 201 : ConsumerSubscribeResponse (OK) Headers : X-Correlation-ID -

      code 400 : ErrorResponse (Bad Request)

      code 401 : InlineResponse401 (401 Unauthorized)

      code 403 : InlineResponse403 (403 Forbidden)

      code 404 : ErrorResponse (Not found)

      code 412 : ErrorResponse (Pre-condition failed)

      code 500 : ErrorResponse (Internal Server Error)

      code 503 : ErrorResponse (Service Unavailable error)

      Parameters:
      hrn - The HERE Resource Name (HRN) of the catalog.
      layerId - The ID of the stream layers.
      mode - Specifies whether to use serial or parallel subscription mode. For more details see [Get Data from a Stream Layer](https://www.here.com/docs/bundle/data-api-developer-guide/page/rest/getting-data-stream.html).
      subscriptionId - Include this parameter if you want to look up the nodeBaseURL for a given subscriptionId.
      consumerId - The ID to use to identify this consumer. It must be unique within the consumer group. If you do not provide one, the system will generate one.
      subscriptionProperties -

    • subscribe

      public StreamApi.SubscribeBuilder subscribe()

    • withConfig

      public StreamApi withConfig(ApiConfiguration apiConfig)
